results.name: Number T(n,k) of endofunctions on [n] where the smallest cycle length equals k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: In general, number of endofunctions on [n] where the smallest cycle length equals k is asymptotic to (exp(-H(k-1)) - exp(-H(k))) * n^n, where H(k) is the harmonic number A001008/A002805, k>=1. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 21 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: A:= (n, k)-> add(binomial(n-1, j-1)*n^(n-j)*b(j, k), j=0..n):
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n-1, j-1]*n^(n-j)*b[j, k], {j, 0, n}];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
